>Is there any chance of getting a
>picture of the "four pointed iron guard device?"

Keith?  If you can take the photo I'll post it.  It's a pretty interesting piece of hardward as I recall.

Craig,
Thanks.  I do remember that tsuba now that I see it.  The seppa dai and nakago ana are unmistakable.  I wonder what that sukashi work was all about.  It certainly is, um, uninhibited. Interesting example.
Jim

>Since we're talking polearm koshirae, I put up a photo of a nagamaki tsuba
that, foolishly, I no longer own. I recall it being 3"+, very smooth
textured iron, thin but strong feeling. Jim, you saw this one a couple of
years ago when we did the Met, perhaps you have more to say about it.

Craig Harris
